data.benefits: Scheme provides subsidy up to 20% of loan amount per unit or maximum of Rs.1.00 lakhs
data.eligibility:
Must be a permanent resident of Karnataka state.
Applicant must be unemployed (submission of self-declared certificate).
data.conditions:
The annual income of the applicant's family should not exceed Rs.98,000/- for rural areas and Rs.1,20,000/- for urban areas.
The candidate should have training/experience/understanding of the business/economic activity to be undertaken.
data.beneficiaries:
Beneficiaries availing the facility under the said scheme are only those who start the proposed unit after 7th July 2023. 
Must be a permanent resident of Karnataka state.
Applicant must be unemployed (submission of self-declared certificate).
data.prerequisites:
The annual income of the applicant's family should not exceed Rs.98,000/- for rural areas and Rs.1,20,000/- for urban areas.
The candidate should have training/experience/understanding of the business/economic activity to be undertaken.
The facility will be provided to only one member of a family.
data.nodal_agency: Nijasharana Ambigara Chowdaiah Development Corporation, Karnataka
data.context: This Scheme is started by Government of Karnataka, it is a scheme for Other Backward Class to generate Employment.
data.objective: To provide loan/subsidy assistance to the unemployed belonging to Backward Classes Category-1, 2A, 3A and 3B for undertaking economic activity in agriculture dependent activities, trade, industrial transport and service sector.
data.description: Scheme will provide subsidy up to 20% of the loan amount sanctioned by nationalized banks and rural banks as well as scheduled banks to the applicants for starting a new business (up to a maximum of Rs. 1lakhs) to undertake economic activities in agriculture-dependent activities, trade, industrial transport and service sectors.
data.how_to_apply:
The eligible individual shall apply through the following Selection Committee constituted under the Chairmanship of Chief Executive Officer, Zilla Panchayat.
Chief Executive Officers, Distt Panchayat 
Lead Bank Managers
Deputy Director, Women and Child Welfare Dept
District Officer, Member of Backward Classes Welfare Department
General Manager, District Industrial Centre
Deputy Commissioners of Co-operative Societies
General Manager (Superintending Engineer) Electricity Supply Company
District Manager, D. Devaraja Government Backward Classes Development Corporation.
data.funding_mechanism: Fund/Incentive will be released on approval of application by the concerned authority after fulfilment of condition.
data.additional_info:
In this scheme, 33% was reserved for women.
This scheme has earmarked 5% reservation for the disabled.
A reservation of 1% has been fixed for Mars-born people.
data.checklist_info_a:
Backward Classes Annual income certificate of caste family obtained from concerned Taluk Tahsildar/Revenue Officer in prescribed format.
Aadhaar Card, 
Electoral ID Card/ Ration Card
passport size photograph
business license from Gram Panchayat/Urban local bodies within three months of establishment of new self-employment/enterprise units,
